title: Recent homes sales in Greater Boston (Feb. 18)
author: The Boston Globe
bullets: A one-family colonial in Boston at 32 W Cedar St sold for $4.8 million, featuring 5 bedrooms, 5 baths.
A condo town house at 31 Mott St. in Arlington, built in 2016, fetched $1.365 million with 3 bedrooms and 3 baths.
In Amesbury, a three-family flat on 102 Market St. built in 1870 sold for $965,500 with 5 bedrooms and 3 baths.

title: Cardi B appears to confirm Stefon Diggs split at L.A. concert
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Cardi B indicated a split with Stefon Diggs at her L.A. concert, mentioning she isn't 'f***ing' with him.
Rumors of their breakup arose after they unfollowed each other on Instagram post-Super Bowl loss.
Stefon Diggs faces upcoming legal proceedings for charges including battery and strangulation.

title: UMass ordered to lift suspension for student who organized pro-Palestinian protest
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: A Superior Court judge ordered UMass to lift a student's suspension over a September 2025 pro-Palestinian protest.
Junior Kivlighan de Montebello claimed UMass violated his First Amendment rights by suspending him for the protest.
The court's ruling prevents UMass from penalizing Montebello further while his free speech case continues.

title: Hanover police officer charged with motor vehicle homicide in fatal Brockton hit-and-run
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Hanover officer Thomas Hayes charged with motor vehicle homicide in Brockton hit-and-run; pled not guilty in court.
Victim Alfredo Alves found unresponsive on Battles Street; died shortly after being taken to Boston Medical Center South.
Hayes allegedly drove under influence after visiting a Brockton strip club; surveillance supported the charges.

title: Choosing a product that fixes foggy headlights
author: John Paul
bullets: Turtle Wax headlight cleaning pads improved foggy headlights but fogging returned within 3 months, Meguiar's Keep Clear lasted 6 months so far.
Foggy headlights can block up to 90% of light; AAA recommends routine maintenance to improve light and prevent refogging.
Volkswagen Jetta's faulty oil pressure regulator issue isn't covered by warranty for some vehicles; a written appeal to VW is suggested.

title: Man arrested in Fenway on child rape, human trafficking charges
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Talik Rashaun Garcia, 36, was arrested in Fenway on charges including child rape and human trafficking.
Garcia pleaded not guilty and was released on $5,000 bail with restrictions on contact with minors.
The Massachusetts State Police High-Risk Victims Squad assisted Boston Police in the arrest and investigation.

title: Man charged with motor vehicle homicide in Pittsfield hit and run that saw victim dragged 4 miles, DA says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: William Gross, 65, charged with motor vehicle homicide after hit-and-run incident in Pittsfield, Massachusetts.
Victim William Colbert, 69, dragged four miles by Gross's vehicle before being found dead near Best Western Hotel.
Gross arrested after extensive investigation; arraignment scheduled for Wednesday in Central Berkshire District Court.

title: Mass. RMV lottery opens for 250th anniversary license plates. Hereâ€™s how to apply.
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Massachusetts RMV launches lottery for special '250th anniversary' license plates, featuring 1776 and 13 stars design.
Applications open until April 17, 2026, for residents with active vehicle registration; no entry fee required.
1,000 plates available; winners pay $60 registration and $40 specialty fee; lottery results by early May.

title: Massachusetts becomes first state to use ChatGPT in the executive branch, drawing criticism
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Massachusetts becomes the first state to implement ChatGPT in its executive branch workforce, affecting nearly 40,000 employees.
Governor Maura Healey aims to improve government efficiency with an AI assistant while ensuring data security and privacy.
The National Association of Government Employees criticizes the rapid rollout, expressing concerns about job impact and AI trustworthiness.

title: Close to 100 jobs lost as 2 Massachusetts packaging plants shut down
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Garlock Flexibles will close two Gardner, MA locations, resulting in the loss of 91 jobs by September.
Astara Capital Partners acquired Garlock in 2021, dividing its paper and flexible film packaging operations.
Garlock Flexibles provides packaging for food, snacks, and produce; future operations in Massachusetts are uncertain.
